required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BAY79-4980 Compared to rFVIII-FS in Previously Treated Patients With Severe Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Active-controlled, Double-blind, Parallel Design Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Once-a-week Prophylaxis Treatment With BAY79-4980 Compared to Three Times-per-week Prophylaxis With rFVIII-FS in Previously Treated Patients With Severe Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: A study to assess treatment with a new formulation of recombinant factor VIII reconstituted with liposomes (BAY79-4980) to evaluate whether a once-a-week treatment is safe and can prevent bleeds in subjects with severe haemophilia A.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Less Than 9 Total Bleeds Per Year
primary_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Less Than 5 Joint Bleeds Per Year
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Joint Bleeds Per Participant Per Year in Responders
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event. Responders were the subjects with less than 9 total bleeds per year

other_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event. Number of bleeds 3 weeks after the first infusion per 12 months

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Bleeds Treated by Various Numbers of Injections
other_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event.
Total number of units per kg of study medication (rFVIII) administered to participant for one year. rFVIII is recombinant factor VIII, factor VIII is functional coagulation factor

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Less Than 9 Total Bleeds Per Year in the Open Label Extension Period
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after start of open label extension period
other_outcome.description: Bleeds occurring on the same day were counted as one bleeding event. Bleeds occurring within 72 hours into the same location were also counted as one bleeding event.

arm_group.description: 35 IU/kg body weight of BAY79-4980 1x/week plus 2 dummy injections/week (dummy = rFVIII (recombinant factor VIII)-FS (formulated with sucrose) excipient reconstituted in WFI (sterile water for injection))

25 IU/kg body weight of rFVIII-FS 3x/week (employing 1 percent POPC (1-palmitoyl-2-oleoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine)-alone liposome (rFVIII-FS-POPC) as blinding agent used for first weekly injection and rFVIII-FS in WFI for 2nd and 3rd injection)

intervention.description: 35 IU/kg body weight intravenous 1x/week for 52 weeks This arm will be stopped by 30.04.10 the subjects will be offered to change to the active comparator arm
25 IU/kg body weight intravenous 3x/week for 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males aged 12 to 70 years
- Subjects with severe hemophilia A (< 1% factor VIII [FVIII]:C)
- Subjects with equal or greater than 150 exposure days (EDs) with any FVIII in total
- Subjects who have been on-demand treatment with a minimum of 1 relevant bleed per month or have been on secondary prophylaxis treatment with not more than a 3x/week schedule
- Subjects with bleeding events and/or treatments during the last 6 months prior to study entry which are documented in the subjects medical records
- Subjects with no measurable inhibitor activity
- Subjects with no history of FVIII inhibitor antibody formation
- Written informed consent by subject and parent / legal representative, if < 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are receiving primary prophylaxis
- Subjects on prophylaxis with documented requirements of > 75 IU/kg/week
- Subjects with any other bleeding disease beside hemophilia A (i.e., von Willebrand disease)
- Subjects with abnormal renal function
- Subjects with elevated hepatic transaminases
- Subjects on treatment with immunomodulatory agents within the last 3 months prior to study entry or during the study
- Subjects with known hypersensitivity to the active substance, mouse or hamster protein, liposomes or polyethyleneglycol (PEG)
- Subjects who require any pre-medication for FVIII injections

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

results_reference.citation: Di Minno G, Cerbone AM, Coppola A, Cimino E, Di Capua M, Pamparana F, Tufano A, Di Minno MN. Longer-acting factor VIII to overcome limitations in haemophilia management: the PEGylated liposomes formulation issue. Haemophilia. 2010 Jan;16 Suppl 1:2-6. doi: 10.1111/j.1365-2516.2009.02155.x. Review.

Powell J, Martinowitz U, Windyga J, Di Minno G, Hellmann A, Pabinger I, Maas Enriquez M, Schwartz L, Ingerslev J; LipLong Study Investigators. Efficacy and safety of prophylaxis with once-weekly BAY 79-4980 compared with thrice-weekly rFVIII-FS in haemophilia A patients. A randomised, active-controlled, double-blind study. Thromb Haemost. 2012 Nov;108(5):913-22. doi: 10.1160/TH12-03-0188. Epub 2012 Sep 26.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Previously treated participants with severe hemophilia A (<1% FVIII (Factor VIII)), who were currently on on-demand or secondary prophylaxis treatment with any FVIII for ≥150 exposure days (ED) with documented bleeds/injections during the last 6 months prior to study entry could participate in the study.

group.title: rFVIII-FS/Pegylated Liposomes (BAY79-4980)
group.description: 35 IU/kg body weight of BAY79-4980 1x/week plus 2 dummy injections/week (dummy = rFVIII (recombinant factor VIII)-FS (formulated with sucrose) excipient reconstituted in WFI (sterile water for injection))

group.title: rFVIII-FS/WFI (BAY14-2222)
group.description: 25 IU/kg body weight of rFVIII-FS 3x/week (employing 1 percent POPC (1-palmitoyl-2-oleoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine)-alone liposome (rFVIII-FS-POPC) as blinding agent used for first weekly injection and rFVIII-FS in WFI for 2nd and 3rd injection)

participants_list.participants: only 67 participants are applicable for baseline characteristic evaluation
only 72 participants are applicable for baseline characteristic evaluation
13 Participants from each group after DB period terminated entered open label follow up.
10 participants of each group entered open-label extension period after completion of DB study

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: target joint
measure.description: The presence or absence of target joints (defined as joints with at least 3 bleeds into the same joint within 6 months) was evaluated.

measure.title: Previous treatment
measure.description: Previous treatment was categorized as prophylaxis versus on demand

group.title: rFVIII-FS/Pegylated Liposomes (BAY79-4980) - Double Blind
group.description: Reporting Group 1 (RG1): Double Blind Study, 35 IU/kg body weight of BAY79-4980 1x/week plus 2 dummy injections/week (dummy = rFVIII-FS excipient reconstituted in WFI)

group.title: rFVIII-FS/WFI (BAY14-2222) - Double Blind
group.description: Reporting group 2 (RG2): Double Blind Study, 25 IU/kg body weight of rFVIII-FS 3x/week (employing 1 percent POPC-alone liposome (rFVIII-FS-POPC) as blinding agent used for first weekly injection and rFVIII-FS in WFI for 2nd and 3rd injection)

group.title: rFVIII-FS/WFI (BAY14-2222) - Follow-up
group.description: Reporting group 3 (RG3): Open Label Follow-up, 25 IU/kg body weight of rFVIII-FS 3x/week (employing 1 percent POPC-alone liposome (rFVIII-FS-POPC) as blinding agent used for first weekly injection and rFVIII-FS in WFI for 2nd and 3rd injection)

group.title: rFVIII-FS/Pegylated Liposomes (BAY79-4980) - Extension
group.description: Reporting group 4 (RG4): Open Label Extension, 35 IU/kg body weight of BAY79-4980 1x/week plus 2 dummy injections/week (dummy = rFVIII-FS excipient reconstituted in WFI)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bayer will have up to 30/45 days to review publications, and may request an additional publication delay of up to 60 days to allow for filing a Patent Application (if applicable). No publication of single center data should be done prior of publication if multi -center data.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The recruitment and double-blind study phase were prematurely terminated after a scheduled interim analysis confirmed overt failure regarding the primary endpoint as judged by the independent Data and Safety Monitoring Board.
